column20:
This PR closes the issue #644 and #801
We have implemented a simple gtk/cairo based screenshot and an RDP plugin based screenshot, it's possible to implement the same mechanism for each plugin.
In the case the plugin screenshot implementation does not exists, remmina will fall back to the gtk/cairo based.
Two contributors have also provided a patch that makes the profile editor notebook content scrollable.

column20:
As reported by #817 positioning a window shouldn't be an application business, but it's the job of the Window Manager.
This PR should fix that particular issue and should improve the window manager interaction in general.

closes #817
closes #829

TODO: I'm still working to improve the notebook managemt as it doesn't work with tiling window manager as GTK doesn't send the right WM hints.

column13: New plugin with basic support for the SPICE protocol

It has been tested on ArchLinux using spice-client-gtk3 and the Xspice server from package xf86-video-qxl.
Please review.

column21:
Hi @larchunix, many thanks for contributing to remmina.
Compilation
I can compile this PR on arch, but not under Ubuntu 16.04.
Under ubuntu I installed libspice-client-gtk-3.0-dev libspice-protocol-dev spice-protocol spice-client-gtk. CMake output says:
-- Finding suggested package SPICE.
--   Disable this using "-DWITH_SPICE=OFF".
-- Checking for module 'spice-protocol'
--   Found spice-protocol, version 0.12.10
-- Checking for module 'spice-client-gtk-3.0'
--   Found spice-client-gtk-3.0, version 0.30

But then, compilation fails with
fatal error: spice-client-gtk.h: No such file or directory
Any ideas to fix this and help me compile ? :)
SSH
Since the plugin does not support the integrated remmina ssh tunnel (remmina_plugin_service->protocol_plugin_start_direct_tunnel()), you are invited to use that function. Or, as a quick fix, remove the SSH configuration page by zeoring "REMMINA_PROTOCOL_SSH_SETTING_TUNNEL" the in remmina_plugin_spice struct.

column13: Initial support for Wayland and Mir
column20:
Allow remmina to be run under native wayland.
Tested under Arch Gnome on Wayland, with
GDK_BACKEND=wayland remmina


Plugins which use GtkSocket will report a correct error and will never be able to run
Remmina still need to be linked to Xorg libraries for some extra functions (ie: keyboard mapping in RDP)

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
Hi @antenore! The refactoring is going in a very good direction, I like it very much - it makes things much easier. I have temporarily switched my openSUSE builds to your branch. It builds and runs without any problems.
Trying it out, I have found things which could still be improved.

Pressing  in the search bar tries to connect to the given address. IMHO most users have their connections stored in a list, so it would be very convenient when pressing  would automatically open the select (filtered) connection from the list.
The connection-type drop-down could be placed after the filter-field, which could be followed by a "quick connect" button to be used to connect to the given address using the given protocol (is there a combined select/submit button available in GTK?)
The "+" button could be moved left to the doughnut-menu-button and the filter/quick-connect related things to the very left of the menu bar.
The list-related commands (connect, copy, edit, delete) should be available via the drop-down menu only - I don't think they are really needed in the global menu. Also the "new" command could be removed from the menu - the new '+' button is very good and clear to understand.
From the list-item-context-menu I would completely remove the "external tools" as they are not related to the items at all. The sorting of the items should be "connect", "---", "edit", "---", "copy", "delete") to distinguish more between the types of commands.

All those remarks are only my personal opinion you can think about; You are working great and Remmina is constantly getting better - thank you!

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
Pressing in the search bar tries to connect to the given address. IMHO most users have their connections stored in a list, so it would be very convenient when pressing would automatically open the select (filtered) connection from the list.

Pressing Enter ? Interesting: I would really benefit for this. But using ENTER for quick connect is important too. It could be done as follow: when, after filtering, only one profile is shown on the filtered list, pressing ENTER on the textbox will connect to that profile ?
I agree with all other @weberhofer's remarks, and add one:
After connecting to a listed profile, remmina updates its .remmina file, but the filtered/sorted list is not automatically refreshed. So during my 2 hours session working for a customer, used profiles does not automatically move at the top of the sorted list. The list of filtered/sorted profiles should autorefresh after each connection. But try to avoid to reparse all profile files when refreshing the list: the slow profile parsing problem is here again in remmina_main: for every key I type, search is very slow.

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
Thanks Johannes, Giovanni
Here after my comments

Pressing  in the search bar tries to connect to the given address. IMHO most users have their connections stored in a list, so it would be very convenient when pressing  would automatically open the select (filtered) connection from the list.

The  behaviour is to replace the quick connect feature I've removed, but as you say, hitting  too early (that is quite instinctive) will try to open a connection with a non existing hosts.
As, while you type, the list is automatically refreshed, the  key is not needed at all.
What I can probably do, is to open the profile editor if the connection fails (?).
@giox069 comment:

when, after filtering, only one profile is shown on the filtered list, pressing ENTER on the textbox will connect to that profile ?

I'm thinking about it. It's not easy and fast for me.

The connection-type drop-down could be placed after the filter-field, which could be followed by a "quick connect" button to be used to connect to the given address using the given protocol (is there a combined select/submit button available in GTK?)

I didn't understand, sorry, would you mind doing a quick sketch (even on paper)?

The "+" button could be moved left to the doughnut-menu-button and the filter/quick-connect
related things to the very left of the menu bar.

I'll try

The list-related commands (connect, copy, edit, delete) should be available via the drop-down menu only - I don't think they are really needed in the global menu. Also the "new" command could be removed from the menu - the new '+' button is very good and clear to understand.

I agree

From the list-item-context-menu I would completely remove the "external tools" as they are not related to the items at all. The sorting of the items should be "connect", "---", "edit", "---", "copy", "delete") to distinguish more between the types of commands.

I may be agree but someone, don't remember who, told me that they use the "external tools" to test the connectivity before to use the profile.
In the future I was thinking to add a status column (I already implemented part of it)

But this is not easy when using ssh_tunnel and rdp/vnc gateway
@giox069 comments:

After connecting to a listed profile, remmina updates its .remmina file, but the filtered/sorted list is not automatically refreshed. So during my 2 hours session working for a customer, used profiles does not automatically move at the top of the sorted list. The list of filtered/sorted profiles should autorefresh after each connection.

This is already done, but at the moment you must move the focus in the quick connect bar.
I don't understand which signal I can use to do it in a better way.

But try to avoid to reparse all profile files when refreshing the list: the slow profile parsing problem is here again in remmina_main: for every key I type, search is very slow.

I've picked and adapted your patch, so I don't know why it doesn't work, would you @giox069 mind taking a look?

@larchunix I'd appreciate your opinion if you have some time for us. Thanks!

move the + button to the left (as in the first screenshots),

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
The GTKHeaderBar is not meant to include complicated layouts, in fact their child components can only be packed at the start or end of the widget.
To have a centered search/quickconnect box I should put  a grid inside the GtkHeaderbar, but IMHO it's too complicated and gross.
As per the Gnome Design Patterns, I should add another bar below the GtkHeader
https://developer.gnome.org/hig/stable/figures/patterns/search.svg
I'll take some more time to play around this idea that I think it's much better.

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
I liked a lot the previous version with the search bar always visible on the first row. Searching, in my daily use, is done very frequently, at each connection. Hiding the search bar is not very useful: I have an extra button shown, I have to unhide it, I lose one line of space. Search, in Remmina, is not an option for me, it's daily life.
If a user does not uses search... he/she could simply ignore it ?
About the G+ poll: we still have too few users and I don't think we will be useful to make a poll now... but it's just another personal opinion. The community is slowly growing, and this is good.

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
I liked a lot the previous version with the search bar always visible on the first row. Searching, in my daily use, is done very frequently, at each connection. Hiding the search bar is not very useful: I have an extra button shown, I have to unhide it, I lose one line of space. Search, in Remmina, is not an option for me, it's daily life.

By default is already unhide, hiding the search bar is an option not the standard. So you can consider just the second screenshot.
Regarding the additional row I agree, but I don't have an easy and clean solution to stack it in the middle. We can just have it on the right (end) or on the left (start).
Moreover consider that I've removed completely the window decoration, so you lost one line but you got a new one, so you have lost zero at the end.
I'm undecided, I let you all decide because I really don't know.
Personally I like more this last solution as it is much more "compliant" and easier to code.

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar

column20: This PR brings a new Remmina Main window using an header bar
column21:
I'm sorry @Chugajstyr but we cannot support two different interfaces.
Unlucky it's not like desktop theme. The modifications we have done are deep in the code.
We discussed these changes between us and openly with the community before to commit them.
Beside usability reasons and beside the fact that we like a lot this new interface , Gnome is clearly taking this direction in terms of layout and as Remmina is (still? yet?) a GTK+ application we have to follow the wave or one day Remmina won't work and/or integrate in a GTK+ environment.
I understand your discomfort and I'm sorry for this, but we cannot do that much.
Please don't hesitate to open new issues or comment to existing ones, when it makes sense we will do our best to support you.

column13: Adds support for themable panel icons
column20:
Just a small fix that allows the tray icon to be themed independently from the icon that is used for the .desktop file. So far these two icons were the same which means that the icon in the tray always looked the same as the icon in the Dash / Launcher.
This fix allows icon themes to provide unique icons for the tray (which are often monochrome) and the app itself.

column20:
When remote is bigger than local display window you can use hostkey + <arrows> to move the view-port to the edges of remote desktop.
It works in both modes: 'fullscreen' an 'not fullscreen'.
P.S.
the README.md points to broken links for development installation, for example:
Compile on Ubuntu 14.04 and 14.10 points to blob/something instead of wiki/ ....

column13: RDP: allow disabling auto reconnection in .remmina file
column21:
Hi,
I updated the commit by adding a respective checkbox to RDP settings UI. While doing that, I decided to change the setting item's name to "disableautoreconnect" and invert its meaning. I did so basically because of two reasons. First, it's more consistent with existing settings like "disablepasswordstoring" or "disableclipboard" which affect features that are meant to be turned on by default (as is autoreconnect). Second, I couldn't figure out how to set the default value of a setting checkbox to TRUE (if it's possible at all).
Please have a look.

We are testing for regressions and we will merge just after (and I'll do the AUTHORS and release stuff afterward)

I have managed to make PKI working for remote-viewer but not for remmina with patches. I am getting the following at the remote side:
Aug 13 19:00:21 testct Xorg[5937]: 139690104429056:error:14094418:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:tlsv1 alert unknown ca:s3_pkt.c:1472:SSL alert number 48
I added a root CA certificate to the trusted store so it seems strange.
Please see the following for a more detailed list of actions I have done:
https://gist.github.com/dshcherb/9ca58931c3f1af43dc7ec4a15d7a6ce9
With remote-viewer the output is (the full invokation of remote-viewer is in the gist):
Aug 13 19:03:11 testct Xorg[5937]: ((null):5937): Spice-Warning **: reds.c:1915:reds_handle_ticket: Invalid password
Aug 13 19:03:14 testct Xorg[5937]: main_channel_link: add main channel client
Aug 13 19:03:16 testct Xorg[5937]: main_channel_handle_parsed: net test: latency 6.377000 ms, bitrate 1982651 bps (1.890803 Mbps) LOW BANDWIDTH
Aug 13 19:03:16 testct Xorg[5937]: red_dispatcher_set_cursor_peer:
Aug 13 19:03:16 testct Xorg[5937]: inputs_connect: inputs channel client create
Please comment if you notice anything wrong in what I am doing or if you need more info/logs.

column13: spice: add support for tls encrypted connections
column20: Please review and test (http://www.spice-space.org/docs/manual/#_tls)
column21:
@dshcherb

Remmina SPICE plugin does not support common spice-gtk options like --spice-ca-file or --spice-host-subject (one more thing to add to my TODO list...). Hence, when generating your self-signed certificate, CN and remote hostname must match. I.e: in your case, you have to replace myhostname.example.com by 10.10.10.247
Remmina SPICE plugin's Server CA Certificate field is equivalent to remote-viewer's --spice-ca-file option. Therefore, you should use ca-cert.pem. (Ignore this bullet point if it is the same file as server-ca.pem).

BTW, thanks for testing.

Thanks! I completely forgot to check the hostname when I generated certificates, so its working now with the regenerated certificates and ca-cert.pem as a "Server CA certificate":

column21:
@larchunix
JFYI, I guessed that EnableSurfaces option might affect this somehow. Setting it to False does its magic:
   # Enable the use of off screen surfaces
    # defaults to True
    #Option "EnableSurfaces" "True"
    Option "EnableSurfaces" "False"

grep -RiP 'EnableSurfaces' xserver xf86-video-qxl 
xf86-video-qxl/src/qxl_driver.c:      "EnableSurfaces",           OPTV_BOOLEAN, { 1 }, FALSE },
xf86-video-qxl/examples/spiceqxl.xorg.conf.example:    #Option "EnableSurfaces" "True"
xf86-video-qxl/scripts/Xspice:#Option "EnableSurfaces" "True"

xf86-video-qxl/src/qxl_driver.c:
    { OPTION_ENABLE_SURFACES,
      "EnableSurfaces",           OPTV_BOOLEAN, { 1 }, FALSE },
...
    xf86DrvMsg (scrnIndex, X_INFO, "Offscreen Surfaces: %s\n",
                qxl->enable_surfaces ? "Enabled" : "Disabled");

So, as expected, not related to how the spice plugin operates. The warnings in the log are gone now.

column13: Spice package and integrated debian packaging.
column20:
With this PR we add a new package for remmina-plugin-spice for ubuntu series that allow its compilation.
Now a debian folder is included in the repository.
The new debian building configuration allow debian/control file templating to be able different packaging for different ubuntu platform, launchpad recipes included.
Here it at works: https://code.launchpad.net/~nastasi/+recipe/mop-experiments-daily
Looking the packages lists for armhf you can see differences between trusty and the other series.
TODO: you must add a proper description for the new remmina-plugin-spice package in debian/control.in file.
NOTE: when merged the recipe for the nightly build must be aligned with the recipe in the mop-exepriments project.
NOTE 2: change the versioning name schema and to support debian will be handled in other PRs.
NOTE 3: a checklist.md could be a good way to maintain consistency at each PR (I discovered trevis config file accidentally looking another opened PR  ).
column21:
With this PR we add a new package for remmina-plugin-spice for ubuntu series that allow its compilation.
Now a debian folder is included in the repository.
The new debian building configuration allow debian/control file templating to be able different packaging for different ubuntu platform, launchpad recipes included.
Here it at works: https://code.launchpad.net/~nastasi/+recipe/mop-experiments-daily
Looking the packages lists for armhf you can see differences between trusty and the other series.
TODO: you must add a proper description for the new remmina-plugin-spice package in debian/control.in file.
NOTE: when merged the recipe for the nightly build must be aligned with the recipe in the mop-exepriments project.
NOTE 2: change the versioning name schema and to support debian will be handled in other PRs.
NOTE 3: a checklist.md could be a good way to maintain consistency at each PR (I discovered trevis config file accidentally looking another opened PR  ).
Much thanks :D

column13: Implementing RDP remote scaling and orientation
column20:
This PR enables RDP server scaling in HiDPI display and screen orientation, and fixes #969.
Remote scaling and orientation are documented in [MS-RDPBCGR] TS_UD_CS_CORE.
Settings are currently not automatically detected from your current monitor: you must manually enable them in remmina global setttings, RDP tab.
Orientation: can be 0, 90, 180, 270 degrees.
Desktop Scale Factor: scaling of desktop and desktop apps, range from 100% to 500%
Device Scale Factor: scaling of metro (appstore?) apps. Works on Win2012R2, windows 10 seems to ignore it. Can only be 100%, 140% or 180%.

column13: spice: show progress of drag & drop file transfers
column20:
Please review and test:

connect to a guest having spice-vdagent running,
drag and drop files from the host to the guest,
a dialog should raise with a progress bar (if files are too small, the dialog is closed promptly),
after the transfer is completed, files can be find on the guest in $XDG_DOWNLOAD_DIR ("$HOME/Downloads")

column21:
So far....
Good job! :-) Thanks so much!
For me it can be merged.
Can you evaluate the following points? If it's easily possible to implemented one or all of them, we wait to merge, otherwise we can think about it afterwards.
The issues I've found.

I cannot copy some file type.
i.e. I cannot copy .core files, it's not something I need to copy... It's just something I've noted
I cannot get the progress bar, but I think it's because it's too fast.
If the file is not transferred there is no notifications.
It'd be nice to have notifications at the end of each transfers.
Are you able to put in place something like what I've done with the screenshots?

Here an example https://github.com/FreeRDP/Remmina/blob/next/remmina/src/remmina_connection_window.c#L1673
An other generic issue, it'd be nice to add a quick tip somewhere explaining that spice-vdagend must be running on the guest server (with the right user). Does spice provide I way to test is the vdaegnt is running?
Sorry for all the questions, but as this feature is quite interesting, I'm curious about everything.

In the code you check that the spice-gtk version is 0.31.0 or newer, in my case I've spice-gtk-0.30_1 , so it shouldn't work, but it does!?!?! It's weird, it shouldn't.

Indeed, it's really weird. Version check is done at compile time. Maybe remmina was compiled on a machine having a more recent version ? (although it should segfault at runtime in this case)


On the same machine, I'll check the include files, it could be also that the package version is not inline.

column21:
@antenore, here are my answers:


I cannot copy some file type.
i.e. I cannot copy .core files, it's not something I need to copy... It's just something I've noted


I can't reproduce. I tried to transfer a bunch of files (including coredump) and it worked fine for me.


I cannot get the progress bar, but I think it's because it's too fast.


Did you try to drag and drop large files to see if the progress bar is displayed smoothly ?


If the file is not transferred there is no notifications.
It'd be nice to have notifications at the end of each transfers.
Are you able to put in place something like what I've done with the screenshots?


This can be easily added in the function remmina_plugin_spice_file_transfer_finished_cb() which is called at the end of each transfer. In my first attempts to implement this, I felt the notifications too annoying. I propose to merge this PR first and I will open another one so that we can experiment different designs more easily.

An other generic issue, it'd be nice to add a quick tip somewhere explaining that spice-vdagend must be running on the guest server (with the right user). Does spice provide I way to test is the vdagent is running?

SpiceMainChannel object provides this information through the agent-connected property. If you have some idea about how to display this information in an elegant way I will gladly try to implement it.

column21:
it include things to be more easy construct debian/ubuntu packages,

Nothing against with, and it's cool! Most of our users are on ubuntu, so we are already somehow oriented and that's why we have a PPA.
What I'm sceptic about, is to have distribution oriented files in the main repository as it may:

Make people we are strongly oriented
Invite other package maintainers  to add their files.

What will happens if also Fedora, Gentoo, FreeBSD, OpenSuSe, Archlinux, (sorry I cannot list all distros here) will ask to add their files in here?
The first issue is that we will have a number of "distro" folders in the Remmina root and the second one is that there will be a lot of job to do every time we will release a new version and also for the nightly builds.
I've probably missed the point, just let me know if I'm wrong.

column21:
What will happens if also Fedora, Gentoo, FreeBSD, OpenSuSe, Archlinux, (sorry I cannot list all distros here) will ask to add their files in here?

Good point, an example of what I had in mind:

there is a new Remmina release:
the official manteiner of distro X updates its fork
he/she updates files that need it
do the new package for distro X
he/she open a PR to us with the changes (that must be in the distro X scope)
we review the code and merge it

But we can think about it more, I move the debian folder outside in a separated repository.
Stay tuned.

column21:
There are some notes about pre-releases in https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Versioning and https://en.opensuse.org/openSUSE:Package_naming_guidelines;
As RPM orders letters before numbers the alpha, beta and rc tags should not be a problem. I personally like version numbers like 1.1.99.rcgit16 most, as those clearly mark pre-releases to 1.2.0 and shouldn't make issues with all the package managers.

column21:
Just drop the rcgit and release the next version as 1.2.0 or 1.2.16. It's been two years since rc1, and each new "release candidate" includes new features.
The distinction between releases and pre-releases is not very useful when you don't maintain a stable branch with backported bug fixes.

column21: I drop this PR, we continue as in the past.

column13: When focus-in inside the quick search, select the whole text as per #544
column20:
This PR does nothing special than just adding an event when entering the quick search entry widget.
It shouldn't break up anything, but please test it if you can.
To test, just enter some text in the quick search, leave the box, with TAB for example and go back again with the S-TAB (with the mouse it won't work and it's normal).

column21: Merging

column20:
Added full support for XDG_DATA_DIRS and XDG_CONFIG_DIRS as requested by #818
To test you can move away your ~/.remmina, or ~/.config/remmina and ~/.local/share/remmina directories.
You can (manually at the moment), populate your $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS/remmina (it should be /etc/xdg/remmina) with your ~/.config/remmina/remmina.pref (and move away the ~/.config/remmina directory). Same for the .remmina files you have under ~/.local/share/remmina, that you can copy into $XDG_DATA_DIRS (normally /usr/share/remmina or /usr/local/share/remmina), again, removing the ~/.local/share/remmina directory.
As a last improvements I was thinking to add by default some template profiles to show up some different Remmina configurations in the XDG system directories.
I think there is still a big issue, but I don't get how should be the good behaviour.
If there are files in the system directories and the user data and config directories don't exists yet, remmina will try to save new profiles under the system directories.
This is quite normally as per my logic and comprehension of the spec.
I can write a script to migrate profiles if you like.

column21:
OK, tested.
Issue one: remmina does not merge data dirs. If there are connections in higher priority dir of ${DG_DATA_HOME}:${XDG_DATA_DIRS}, or even just an empty dir exists, then connections from lower priority dirs are not shown.
Issue two: remmina does not write config to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME, always reads from $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS. [edit] it also does not save connections to $XDG_DATA_HOME.
Issue three (off-topic): can those damned GNOME CSD's be turned off? Either at build time or if running not in GNOME? Sorry.

column21:
OK, tested.

Thank you.

Issue one: remmina does not merge data dirs. If there are connections in higher priority dir of ${DG_DATA_HOME}:${XDG_DATA_DIRS}, or even just an empty dir exists, then connections from lower priority dirs are not shown.
I'm not sure is how it should work as per the freedesktop XDG spec.
All the software I use, for what I remember the use the first directory found starting form the higher priority.

Probably the best is to provide scripts to migrate and merge profiles and configuration files? This should fix also the second issue.

Issue two: remmina does not write config to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME, always reads from $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS. [edit] it also does not save connections to $XDG_DATA_HOME.

If Remmina will try to write inside /etc or /usr/ it's normal because your user doesn't have the right to write there.

Issue three (off-topic): can those damned GNOME CSD's be turned off? Either at build time or if running not in GNOME? Sorry.

What are those "GNOME CDS's"?

column21:
By XDG hierarchy logic, remmina should show all connections that exist in ${XDG_DATA_HOME}:${XDG_DATA_DIRS}. When file names collide, use the highest priority file. Write only to ${XDG_DATA_HOME} (obviously). I.e. when editing connection that came from ${XDG_DATA_DIRS}, create new file in ${XDG_DATA_HOME} overriding it.
Same logic basically applies to config hierarchy.
Right now remmina seems to choose highest priority dir existing, ignoring all other, and tries to use it exclusively for reading and writing, which is pointless.
CSD's - client side decorations, when application tries to do window manager's job. Looks out of place outside GNOME.

column21:
By XDG hierarchy logic, remmina should show all connections that exist in ${XDG_DATA_HOME}:${XDG_DATA_DIRS}. When file names collide, use the highest priority file. Write only to ${XDG_DATA_HOME} (obviously). I.e. when editing connection that came from ${XDG_DATA_DIRS}, create new file in ${XDG_DATA_HOME} overriding it.
Same logic basically applies to config hierarchy.
Right now remmina seems to choose highest priority dir and tries to use it exclusively for reading and writing, which is pointless.

No, sorry but this by me it's wrong, or I get it wrong.
Reading the specification and man file-hierarchy, applications should not mix-up data and configuration files but read the one with the highest priority.
Now, and here I'm fighting with myself to find a good logic, if I open and modify a file that is inside XDG_DATA_DIRS (I don't even have a ${XDG_DATA_HOME} ), should I save it back to the XDG_DATA_DIRS or the ${XDG_DATA_HOME} one?
In my mind I should try to save it in the XDG_DATA_DIRS at first, and than, as a fallback if the remmina instance does not have writing rights in the ${XDG_DATA_DIRS} , save it in the ${XDG_DATA_HOME}. (same for the config)
Showing/merging both files it's not something any other applications do as far as I know.
ON the other hand I saw application (like i3wm) that provides scripts/tools to migrate, import generate files starting from the default ones.

column21:
${XDG_DATA_DIRS} (usually  /usr/local/share:/usr/share) and ${XDG_CONFIG_DIRS} (usually /etc/xdg) are system-level dirs, user has only read permissions on them, so there is no point in trying to write there, only read.
Writing of user data and configuration should be performed to ${XDG_DATA_HOME} (usually $HOME/.local/share) and ${XDG_CONFIG_HOME} (usually $HOME/.config) accordingly.
When reading data or configuration, any particular file in higher priority dir wins, not the whole dir wins. I.e. If you have /etc/xdg/remmina/remmina.pref and empty $HOME/.config/remmina/, you read  /etc/xdg/remmina/remmina.pref. When you  change configuration, you write to $HOME/.config/remmina/remmina.pref and use it from now on because it exists now and $HOME/.config/remmina/ has higher priority.
If you have connection files:

/usr/share/remmina/connection1.remmina
/usr/local/share/remmina/connection3.remmina
$HOME/.local/share/remmina/connection1.remmina
$HOME/.local/share/remmina/connection2.remmina

client should produce a list:

connection1
connection2
connection3

where connection1 was read from $HOME/.local/share/ as it has higher priority than /usr/share/
If you edit connection3, it would be written to  $HOME/.local/share/

column20:
Added full support for XDG_DATA_DIRS and XDG_CONFIG_DIRS as requested by #818
To test you can move away your ~/.remmina, or ~/.config/remmina and ~/.local/share/remmina directories.
You can (manually at the moment), populate your $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS/remmina (it should be /etc/xdg/remmina) with your ~/.config/remmina/remmina.pref (and move away the ~/.config/remmina directory). Same for the .remmina files you have under ~/.local/share/remmina, that you can copy into $XDG_DATA_DIRS (normally /usr/share/remmina or /usr/local/share/remmina), again, removing the ~/.local/share/remmina directory.
As a last improvements I was thinking to add by default some template profiles to show up some different Remmina configurations in the XDG system directories.
I think there is still a big issue, but I don't get how should be the good behaviour.
If there are files in the system directories and the user data and config directories don't exists yet, remmina will try to save new profiles under the system directories.
This is quite normally as per my logic and comprehension of the spec.
I can write a script to migrate profiles if you like.

column21:
Config: it still does not save user config, but reads system-level config successfully.
Data: It copies connections from system-level dirs to user-level dirs on launch. This is sort of OK, but screws with use case of admin tweaking default connections deployed on the workstations. It would be better to write connection file on user-level only when editing, but until then read directly from system-level dir. So if a connection is not yet overridden by user, any changes to system-level file would be accessible to user.

Thanks for the test.

Config: it still does not save user config, but reads system-level config successfully.

Weird, it shouldn't, I'll check

Data: It copies connections from system-level dirs to user-level dirs on launch. This is sort of OK, but screws with use case of admin tweaking default connections deployed on the workstations. It would be better to write connection file on user-level only when editing, but until then read directly from system-level dir. So if a connection is not yet overridden by user, any changes to system-level file would be accessible to user.

Remmina file names are composed by a random generated number like 123456789 and the extension .remmina.
If you have the same file (so, the same file name) in the XDG_DATA_DIRS and XDG_USER_DATA_DIR, the one in the XDG_USER_DATA_DIR will be used. If, on the other way around, that files does not exists, remmina will copy it on the  XDG_USER_DATA_DIR.
I think your issue is that you have files that have a different naming convention and this, at the moment, cannot be changed easily.
If it's not this the issue please provide me some real example.
Another thing I cannot do easily is the scenario where the user already have a profile named 12345.remmina and the admin wants to update it on a system-level. It'd complicate too much things I think.
@joakim-tjernlund can you give also your feedback please?

Just read directly from topmost priority file without copying anything.
If user edits connection or config, write the file that changed to user-level dir.
go to 1

Naming convention does not matter, as long as file name is the same.

column21:
Read what exists, write when necessary, repeat.  If user does not edit anything, nothing gets written. If user edits something, affected files are written to user-level dir and get priority.
Do you have any questions about this algorithm left? I hope there is no more misunderstanding.
From what I am able to see from the outside without knowledge of remmina's internals, it can already find topmost priority data and config files in the hierarchy. So it is a matter of repeating this step when something gets edited. And write only on edit.

column21:
Fairly typical XDG setup:
$ env | grep 'XDG_DATA\|XDG_CONFIG'
XDG_CONFIG_DIRS=/etc/xdg
XDG_CONFIG_HOME=/home/user/.config
XDG_DATA_DIRS=/usr/local/share:/usr/share
XDG_DATA_HOME=/home/user/.local/share

A bit more extensive testing... system-level connections:
/usr/local/share/remmina/conn_A.remmina correctly selected, used (copied to user-level)
/usr/share/remmina/conn_A.remmina # correctly ignored
/usr/share/remmina/conn_B.remmina # incorrectly ignored, not listed.

column21:
Looks good! Correct files are being chosen. (at least for data, I haven't tested multiple $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS. If it uses the same algorithm, then it should be fine).
So the only thing left to do is to make copying on-demand, rather than on start. This would probably require defaulting option "remember last view for each connection" to false and making "save settings when starting connection" to only write when something was actually changed in connection.
Low priority on this is perfectly fine by me, now that XDG basics work.
...some other minor thing: Deleting connection from the list. If connection file exists in system-level dirs, user can not actually remove it. There are two ways of dealing with this:

replace "Delete" with "Reset" (remove user-level connection file, read from system-level again).
replace "Delete" with "Hide" (similar to desktop entries in XDG autostart: write some parameter like 'hidden=true'  to connection file to hide this connection)

column13: Show information on upgrade libssh to 0.7.X
column20:
On Ubuntu below 16.04, libssh is still at version 0.6.X. This makes it impossible to connect to more securely configured SSH servers like shown in this bug issue: https://github.com/FreeRDP/Remmina/issues/983
This change helps people trying to figure out on how to connect to SSH servers using more secure algorithms which aren't supported by libssh 0.6.X.

column13: Improves focus in/out detection when keyboard is captured
column20:
This is a possible fix for issue #146.
Currently in GTK when keyboard is captured via gdk_device_grab(), the application no longer receives "focus-out-event". This fix uses the "window-state-event" signal instead "focus-out-event" to detect focus loss and release the keyboard.

column20:
From my testing on a Fedora 25 (Gnome 3.22) system, it looks like placing the window in fullscreen from the idle callback is too soon and always places the window on monitor 0 (left one).
If gtk_window_fullscreen() is called from the "map-event" event, it places the window on the same monitor where the window was.
I didn't experience the black border issue mentioned in the previous comment. Using a signal instead of the idle callback means we don't need to track the event source identifier, which removes some code.
I'd be happy if somebody could test this on other environments (non Gnome, or pre-3.22 versions).

column20:
This should fix #124 if GTK version => 3.18

column21:
No problem. I understand there are many situations. BTW, thanks for the work on Remmina!
I have a laptop at the left with external monitor to the right, openSuse 42.2 KDE plasma5, Remmina 1.2.0 rcgit.13.
If I have a rdp connection with Remmina open, not full screen - completely on the external monitor.
Then I toggle Remmina to full screen mode (with the Remmina button).
What happens next, is that the full screen opens either on the laptop screen, or on the external monitor, depending on the connection window location:

Connection window not open - the full screen opens on the laptop (left) - unexpected.
Connection window at the laptop screen - the full screen opens on the laptop (left) - unexpected.
Connection window open at the right monitor: the full screen opens on the right - expected.

column21:
Yep, that's a good point.
I think the best is to let the user choose adding an option in the Remmina preferences. Thought it won't be anyway that much flexible as well, but I don't see how it can be done better.
Do you mind to cut and paste this in a new issue? Thanks in advance.
I hope that I'll have time ASAP.

In the following strings, for example:

#: remmina/src/remmina_file_editor.c:460 remmina/src/remmina_pref_dialog.c:79
#: remmina/ui/remmina_preferences.glade:250
msgid "Resolutions"
msgstr ""
#: remmina/src/remmina_file_editor.c:460 remmina/src/remmina_pref_dialog.c:79
msgid "Configure the available resolutions"
msgstr ""
#: remmina/src/remmina_file_editor.c:478
msgid "Resolution"
msgstr ""
#: remmina/src/remmina_connection_window.c:1738
msgid "Resize the window to fit in remote resolution"
msgstr ""

I think that the correct word is definition, like in high definition TV (i.e. number of pixels for a display), not resolution. The resolution is the number of pixels per surface unit (i.e. PPI pixel per inch). Though, this is a very current wrong usage of the word resolution

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Display_resolution
Even if the usage is wrong it's globally accepted/used, so I'm afraid that changing it could have a bad effect.
I cannot decide myself, @giox069 ,  @ic3d what do you think?

Also: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_display_resolution
I agree with the fact that "resolution" has the alternative meaning of PPI (and in physics the meaning of resolution is closer to PPI than widthxheight).
But in the last 20 years I have almost never seen a technical document saying "your monitor has a 1024x768 definition". Also try to google for 1024x768 (or 1920x1080) definition and you will find almost nothing which concatenates the two search term.
All documents I have found in my life and I can find on google uses the word "resolution" to describe width and height in quantity of pixels.

So its a semantic slipping. ;-)
All right guys, let it be!
Merging. I've even forgot about his.

column13: Review and fix fullscreen toolbar. Improve Remmina instance management on system.
column20: I order to minimize the toolbar with less functionality in order to avoid users to change options and focus only on RDP fullscreen connection.
column21:
Hello,
the point about to minimize the toolbar in fullscreen mode, is because of my scenario. I am using Remmina on a ThinClient based on Debian Raspberry Pi 3 terminals.
I wanted to have all the control and prevent users to change everything, just click on an desktop icon, launch remmina with -c command and show their remote virtualised desktop for each user. In my company I am working to virtualize everything and change all computers and install raspberry as thinclient with remmina.
The thing is, depends of the scenario in some cases is useful to have all the original icons and functionalities on toolbar fullscreen, but in other cases is necessary to limit access to this, in the same way I can clear all keyboard commands in settings, change it and clear if I want for limited users.
It would be perfect to have the ability to choose what icons I want to put on the Connection Window Toolbar (fullscreen or not), in order to limit o allow full access to all funcionalitys (switch between fullscreen, exit without close session...)
So thats the point about the toolbar.
Thanks!

column13: Review and fix fullscreen toolbar. Improve Remmina instance management on system.
column20: I order to minimize the toolbar with less functionality in order to avoid users to change options and focus only on RDP fullscreen connection.
column21:
I see your point and it's interesting, but it's indeed better to give the choice to the user whenever they want or not to show some icons.
If you are up to it it would be good to have a new tab in the remmina_pref_dialog.c with a checkbox for each icon.
Regarding the "remmina quit", on i3wm, when I quit the remmina_file_editor window and there is an already opened connection, nothing happens. How is implemented by your PR, we risk to receive some bug request because the Quit command does not work.
Some good behaviors would be:

Show a popup saying Remmina cannot be closed because there are opened connections.
Otherwise minimize the remmina_file_editor.
Otherwise, but this is quite complex, change completely the forking/threading model of Remmina.

Ideally is better to split this PR in two different ones, but at the moment we can keep this opened for discussion. As soon as @giox069 will have some time will comment with his thoughts as well.
Please keep working on this, we are interested and thanks a lot for your support.

column21: I will add "is", but check also for "has expired" vs "is expired". Which one ?

column13: Add descriptions for some freerdp exit status code
column20: @antenore: I added 4 new text strings for these errors. Can you have them reviewed by a English mother tongue technician ?
column21:
In general, you should use "to be" or "to have" in accordance of the first verb in a sentence, for example:

I have checked and the account has already expired (have -> has).

Another thing is that "is expired"  implies a long-standing condition (The account is expired sine 2 years), "has expired" a recent change in the state (the account has just expired).
So, "is expired", as we don't know when, should be the most appropriate. Than I don't think we have several Oxford users to care so much in this case ;-)
Go for "is expired", "is locked out" etc.
Thank you Sir. Beckett!!

column13: Add descriptions for some freerdp exit status code
column20: @antenore: I added 4 new text strings for these errors. Can you have them reviewed by a English mother tongue technician ?
column21:
@antenore: it should be fine to merge now.
This patch adds 4 possible error return code from libfreerdp. But not all four seems to be currently implemented inside libfreerdp. I was only able to test and have good results only with STATUS_ACCOUNT_DISABLED and STATUS_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OUT.

column20:
Snaps are generated for both amd64 and i386 arch.
Deploy is done on new tags (releases) to the stable channel and on new commits to the edge channel.
This repo has alreaedy been configured in travis with encrypted keys to be able to push snaps to the ubuntu store.
Added some infos to the README too.

column20:
No prompt information while another login using the same account #1114
More detailed error messages
Use the function to get the error message instead of the specified string
column21:
Thank you for the patch. Code seems to be fine.
The problem is only internationalization of strings. We cannot use libfreerdp strings (via freerdp_get_error_info_string()) for messages displayed the end user.
Strings returned by external functions have 2 problems:

They usally are not translated (freerdp has not translation files)
They cannot be extracted automatically for translation by xgettext tool.

So a better solution should be:
sprintf(buf, "ERRINFO_DISCONNECTED_BY_OTHER_CONNECTION (0x%08"PRIX32") %s",
  ((FREERDP_ERROR_ERRINFO_CLASS << 16) | ERRINFO_DISCONNECTED_BY_OTHER_CONNECTION),
  _("Another user connected to the server, forcing the disconnection of the current connection.")));

In the above code, xgettext will be able to find the message and then create the apposite entry in all our language translation (.po) files.
Also please note that an hex code on a message shown to a user is usually not a good idea, because the immediate reaction of the average user is "I will not read it because I do not understand it, it's like reading an unknown alphabet".
If a more advanced user will need more information, he/she just need to run remmina from a terminal window and get hex code which will be shown by libfreerdp itself.
So, IMHO I will remove hex code and macro name too. It's just unknown alphabet for 80% of readers and they will never read the true message content which follows macro name and hex code.

column13: The host key should not affect subsequent key operations
column20:
For example, when you use the host key to complete the full-screen mode (ctrl_r + f),
the subsequent key operation has two effects:
Continue to full-screen mode does not need the host key, such as directly
by "f" can be achieved
In the editing interface can not enter other buttons until you press ctrl_r again,
I think this affects the user's experience
I have tested,looks well

column13: Add disable_floating_toolbar option to disable the floating toolbar in full screen mode.
column20:
Adds a boolean option, disable_floating_toolbar, to completely disable the floating toolbar, for those of us that use Remmina like a thin client.
Floating toolbar gets in the way in a Windows RDP when you move the cursor to the top of the screen.  Moving it to the bottom doesn't help either, because then it interferes with the taskbar.

column13: Add an option to completely disable the floating toolbar in fullscreen mode
column20:
Added an option to completely disable the floating toolbar in fullscreen mode.  This is useful for people like me who use Remmina like a thin client.
The floating toolbar interferes in a Windows RDP session when you bring the cursor to the top (I exit the session by accident all the time), and if you move it to the bottom, it interferes with the Windows taskbar.
I'm not very familiar with the Remmina code base, so please let me know if there's a better way to do something.  I tried to pattern my changes after your existing code.
By the way - thanks for a great product!  Remmina has been very handy over the years!!

column21:
Yes, I agree... this is confusing.
What do you think about this?  Remove the two floating toolbar options, and add a new dropdown, called "Fullscreen toolbar options".  It would have 3 options: Peeking, Hidden, and Disabled.  "Peeking" is the default behavior where it shows the small handle, Hidden is where the toolbar does not show, except when you bring your mouse to the top of the screen, and "Disabled" is this new behavior where you must use the host key to exit fullscreen.

column13: Add an option to completely disable the floating toolbar in fullscreen mode
column20:
Added an option to completely disable the floating toolbar in fullscreen mode.  This is useful for people like me who use Remmina like a thin client.
The floating toolbar interferes in a Windows RDP session when you bring the cursor to the top (I exit the session by accident all the time), and if you move it to the bottom, it interferes with the Windows taskbar.
I'm not very familiar with the Remmina code base, so please let me know if there's a better way to do something.  I tried to pattern my changes after your existing code.
By the way - thanks for a great product!  Remmina has been very handy over the years!!
column21:
Tested, it's perfect for me. If @giox069 have nothing to add I'd merge it.
Remember us to add your name in the contributor list and in the About widget.

column13: Office software reflect slowly to copy or cut text
column20:
In the use of word or excel to copy or cut operation, often slow response, but this phenomenon seems to exist only in office software, Notepad test is normal.
Checking the Disable clipboard sync in the Remote Desktop Settings dialog box can solve this problem, but it has lost some functionality.
In the commit, the waiting time is changed to 0, you can see the reaction is faster at the same time in the test did not find the introduction of other obvious effects, not entirely clear why the default is set to 2, whether there is a special role.
Perhaps this is not the best solution, what other people's advice or whether to provide a better solution.

column13: Pressing Enter in the Domain entry of Auth dialog submits
column20: In the authentication dialog where the user name, password and domain are entered, currently the dialog is submitted by pressing the Enter key only in the password entry. With this modification, pressing the Enter key in the domain entry submits the dialog, too. Since the domain entry is the last entry of the form, I often try to submit the form by pressing the Enter key in vain.

column13: RDP: remove server hostname DNS check
column20: Now freerdp has better error handling. We no longer need to check if the server hostname exists: libfreerdp will take care of it and return us FREERDP_ERROR_DNS_NAME_NOT_FOUND if the host does not exists.

column13: Implementing separate user and password for RD Gateway
column20:
Currently Remmina send the same user password of the RDP server to the RD Gateway.
This patch implement the double authentication and fixes also other bugs around the remmina_editor.

RD Gateway authentication doesn't work #511
Only stored passwords when connecting via RD-Gateway #922
RD  Gateway Doesn't Support different username/password #933
Remmina profile editor scrolling is broken #1179
Remmina RDP hangs after second certificate confirmation when using RD gateway #706

Closes #511 #922 #933 #1179 #706
column21:
Currently Remmina send the same user password of the RDP server to the RD Gateway.
This patch implement the double authentication and fixes also other bugs around the remmina_editor.

RD Gateway authentication doesn't work #511
Only stored passwords when connecting via RD-Gateway #922
RD  Gateway Doesn't Support different username/password #933
Remmina profile editor scrolling is broken #1179
Remmina RDP hangs after second certificate confirmation when using RD gateway #706

Closes #511 #922 #933 #1179 #706

#708 the checkbox, 'Save SSH Password',  grayed out.

Some enhancements require  libssh 0.7.X, i.e the support for ed25519 keys

Built on Fedora 26 beta 1, using https://github.com/FreeRDP/Remmina/wiki/Compile-on-Fedora-20 only had to install rpmfusion free, as ffmpeg-devel does not exist
sudo dnf install https://download1.rpmfusion.org/free/fedora/rpmfusion-free-release-$(rpm -E %fedora).noarch.rpm

column13: Change Status Icon availability for gnome 3.16
column20:
For Gnome Shell >= 3.16, we assume that GtkStatusIcon is visible on the drawer at the bottom left of the screen. So we do not quit remmina when all windows are closed and GtkStatusIcon is visible.
Fixes #1229

column13: Make building the VNC plugin optional
column20: Note about zlib: I found no mentions of it elsewhere in the code, so it seems that it is only a dependency of LibVNCServer, not Remmina itself. Probably a holdover from when LibVNCServer was bundled with Remmina.

I'm merging this right now.
It's a pity that we have released a new version just 2 days ago. You will see your code published in the next release, rcgit-21, and your name will be added to the contributors list as well.

column13: RDP client keyboard mapping with GTK3
column20:
This patch upgrades the RDP settings "Use client keyboard mapping" by

removing old legacy X11 code and replacing it with GTK3 code
using TS_UNICODE_KEYBOARD_EVENT RDP message to send the server keystrokes already processed at the client side

This should fixes or help fixing issues #440 #1026 and #434

column21:
Hello, congratulations for your software, very useful!
Maybe I can report some issue with keyboard:
I am using Ubuntu 16.04 LTS 64 bits with Remmina 1.2.0-rcgit-21 (git rcgit-21), always with RDP at Windows 7 machines. My keyboard is latinoamerican, so space key is not working for select elements or "push" buttons on Mozilla Firefox 56.0 (and other software neither).
For writing is OK space is inserted but for other do not works, only mouse help in that cases!
The accented characters () was working very well before, but not now! I press accent key once, after letter vocal and only writes the letter vocal not accented. If I press accent key twice retuns two apostrophes (I do not know if anothers users have same problem).
Thanks for your help, best regards,

column20:
This PR implement the custom color scheme for SSH as requested in the issue #1235.
A default theme is loaded during the first remmina startup inside the remmina.pref file.
You can set a new scheme in different ways.

Using the import widget in the Remmina preferences dialog.

You can download Remmina color scheme files from https://github.com/mbadolato/iTerm2-Color-Schemes


Create one using the color editor in the Remmina preferences dialog


The geek way, editing the file ~/config/remmina/remmina.colors


With the following syntax:
[ssh_colors]
background = #d5ccba
cursor = #45373c
foreground = #45373c
color0 =  #20111b
color1 = #be100e
color2 = #858162
color3 = #eaa549
color4 = #426a79
color5 = #97522c
color6 = #989a9c
color7 = #968c83
color8 = #5e5252
color9 = #be100e
color10 = #858162
color11 = #eaa549
color12 = #426a79
color13 = #97522c
color14 = #989a9c
color15 = #d5ccba

Or you can use the rgb colors, like (careful this custom theme it's awful)
[ssh_colors]
background=rgb(156,151,204)
cursor=rgb(112,130,132)
foreground=rgb(250,91,138)
color0=rgb(0,40,49)
color1=rgb(209,28,36)
color2=rgb(115,138,5)
color3=rgb(165,119,6)
color4=rgb(33,118,199)
color5=rgb(198,28,111)
color6=rgb(83,88,55)
color7=rgb(234,227,203)
color8=rgb(0,30,39)
color9=rgb(189,54,19)
color10=rgb(151,255,112)
color11=rgb(83,104,112)
color12=rgb(112,130,132)
color13=rgb(89,86,186)
color14=rgb(129,144,144)
color15=rgb(252,244,220)

In the future I will try to add a per profile custom color scheme.
Please test and let me know.

column20:
This PR implement the custom color scheme for SSH as requested in the issue #1235.
A default theme is loaded during the first remmina startup inside the remmina.pref file.
You can set a new scheme in different ways.

Using the import widget in the Remmina preferences dialog.

You can download Remmina color scheme files from https://github.com/mbadolato/iTerm2-Color-Schemes


Create one using the color editor in the Remmina preferences dialog


The geek way, editing the file ~/config/remmina/remmina.colors


With the following syntax:
[ssh_colors]
background = #d5ccba
cursor = #45373c
foreground = #45373c
color0 =  #20111b
color1 = #be100e
color2 = #858162
color3 = #eaa549
color4 = #426a79
color5 = #97522c
color6 = #989a9c
color7 = #968c83
color8 = #5e5252
color9 = #be100e
color10 = #858162
color11 = #eaa549
color12 = #426a79
color13 = #97522c
color14 = #989a9c
color15 = #d5ccba

Or you can use the rgb colors, like (careful this custom theme it's awful)
[ssh_colors]
background=rgb(156,151,204)
cursor=rgb(112,130,132)
foreground=rgb(250,91,138)
color0=rgb(0,40,49)
color1=rgb(209,28,36)
color2=rgb(115,138,5)
color3=rgb(165,119,6)
color4=rgb(33,118,199)
color5=rgb(198,28,111)
color6=rgb(83,88,55)
color7=rgb(234,227,203)
color8=rgb(0,30,39)
color9=rgb(189,54,19)
color10=rgb(151,255,112)
color11=rgb(83,104,112)
color12=rgb(112,130,132)
color13=rgb(89,86,186)
color14=rgb(129,144,144)
color15=rgb(252,244,220)

In the future I will try to add a per profile custom color scheme.
Please test and let me know.

column21:
Yes the latest build allows the preferences to be opened.
However for some reason nothing in the preferences menu is being saved.
For example, starting with a blank config:
troylea@E4300-Linux-Mint ~ $ rm ./.config/remmina/remmina.pref 
troylea@E4300-Linux-Mint ~ $ ls -la ./.config/remmina/remmina.pref 
ls: cannot access './.config/remmina/remmina.pref': No such file or directory

Then I open remmina in another terminal.
I open the preferences menu and change an option like "Use system default font" and click close.
I open the preferences menu again and the option I changed has not been saved.
I exit remmina.
Here is the terminal output:
troylea@E4300-Linux-Mint ~/remmina_devel/Remmina $ remmina
StatusNotifier/Appindicator support: not supported by desktop. libappindicator will try to fallback to GtkStatusIcon/xembed

(remmina:7579): Gdk-CRITICAL **: gdk_window_thaw_toplevel_updates: assertion 'window->update_and_descendants_freeze_count > 0' failed
****

You can see the config file was re-created:
troylea@E4300-Linux-Mint ~ $ ls -la ./.config/remmina/remmina.pref 
-rw-rw-r-- 1 troylea troylea 1707 Sep 14 18:39 ./.config/remmina/remmina.pref

column20:
Use the cmake builtin Threads library detection, and bail out if it
wasn't pthreads. This allows deleting the cmake/FindPTHREAD.cmake file
which complains because pthreads doesn't provide a pkg-config file.
In newer versions of cmake the FindThreads module has the
THREADS_PREFER_PTHREAD_FLAG variable and creates a Threads::Threads
import target. However, in order to remain compatible with older
cmake versions this is not used.
Also, it seems pthreads is used unconditionally in the code, thus don't make it optional in cmakefiles.

column20:
shortcutkey_viewonly - hardcoded Host+M - working
Patched 3 files to cause Host+M to toggle viewonly mode.
It has been very frustrating to have to move (local and remote) remote mouse pointer for the so frequent action "turn off viewonly, type / click as needed, turn on viewonly". Now it is extremely quicker to press Host+M, type / click as needed, Host+M. Patch is immediately functional, but to achieve release-grade quality, someone needs to add a button in the Preferences dialog -> Keyboard tab to customize the shortcut. (I tried but failed).

column20:
In gnome shell 3.26 the legacyTray (drawer) has been removed,
and there is no place where GtkStatusIcons will be shown.
See

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=785956
https://blogs.gnome.org/aday/2017/08/31/status-icons-and-gnome/

In this case, remmina must exit when the main window is closed.
This undoes PR #1230, requested in issues #1236 and #1229

Can you not do this until an equivalent alternative exists?
For the same reason Gnome 3.26 still supports status icons with TopIcons* extensions.
Thanks

column20:
In gnome shell 3.26 the legacyTray (drawer) has been removed,
and there is no place where GtkStatusIcons will be shown.
See

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=785956
https://blogs.gnome.org/aday/2017/08/31/status-icons-and-gnome/

In this case, remmina must exit when the main window is closed.
This undoes PR #1230, requested in issues #1236 and #1229
column21:
Not possible to undo. Thousand users does not have TopIcons extension installed: if we undo, thousand users will have remmina left running after they close the main windows, with no ways to close it.
The alternative will be to develop appropriate code that detect TopIcons or equivalent tool, test if it is working, do the correct assumptions (i.e. when gnome shell is running  AND gnome shell > 3.26 AND TopIcons is found working) and then avoid exiting. If someone wants to develop, test and maintain this code... he/she is welcome.

column13: Server name is notified to the user everytime we enter a tab
Implementation of dynamic resolution update for RDP
column20:
This PR enables "Dynamic Resolution Updates" for the RDP protocol.
A new scaling mode is added to the remmina_connection_window, and the RDP plugin is extended as needed.
Dynamic Resolution Updates allows the remote desktop to be resized according the current connection windows size. It works only with RDP protocol and when the remote server is Windows2012R2/Windows8.1 or newer.
This PR is a partial fix for issues #1275 and #6
@muflone: there is a plugin API change: function "gboolean protocol_plugin_get_scale()" of RemminaPluginService has been extended to return an integer enum and renamed to remmina_protocol_widget_get_current_scale_mode().
column21:
This PR enables "Dynamic Resolution Updates" for the RDP protocol.
A new scaling mode is added to the remmina_connection_window, and the RDP plugin is extended as needed.
Dynamic Resolution Updates allows the remote desktop to be resized according the current connection windows size. It works only with RDP protocol and when the remote server is Windows2012R2/Windows8.1 or newer.
This PR is a partial fix for issues #1275 and #6
@muflone: there is a plugin API change: function "gboolean protocol_plugin_get_scale()" of RemminaPluginService has been extended to return an integer enum and renamed to remmina_protocol_widget_get_current_scale_mode().

column20:
I've reverted the notification in favor the floating toolbar.
When you are in fullscreen (tabbed mode) and you switch between profiles, the floating toolbar temporary appears.
As there is the server name in the floating toolbar, we always now on which profile we are working on.

column20:
Fix for issue #1300.
Please note that VNC is very limited in clipboard handling, and the only charset supported is latin-1 (ISO-8859-1), see RFC6143 7.5.6.

Thank you!!!
It'll be available in the next release of Remmina, that will happen in few days as we have to fix an urgent bug.
Can you kindly add yourself in the AUTHORS and in the remmina/ui/remmina_about.glade files? Just add a commit to this PR. If you don't have time I'll do myself.
I'll answer to your issue #1326 ASAP.
Thanks a lot again!

I think there is a problem with the translator credits.
Usually in other software there is the msgid "translator-credits" so translators can add them self in the file.
#: remmina/src/remmina_about.c:54
msgid "translator-credits"
msgstr ""
"Launchpad Contributions:\n"
"  Joe Hansen https://launchpad.net/~joedalton2\n"
"  Niels Kristensen https://launchpad.net/~nielskri\n"
"  Vic https://launchpad.net/~llyzs\n"
"scootergrisen"

But here is says translator_credits in the code already filled in with others names.
Should this perhaps be empty and filled in with the string from above when using danish language?
    <property name="translator_credits" translatable="yes">Adolfo Jayme Barrientos <fitojb@ubuntu.com>
Antenore Gatta <antenore@simbiosi.org>
Emmanuel Grognet <emmanuel@grognet.fr>
Giovanni Panozzo <giovanni@panozzo.it>
Jean-Louis Dupond <jean-louis@dupond.be>
Jose Gregorio Jimenez Sanchez <josegjimenez@gmail.com>
Fabio Castelli (muflone) <muflone@vbsimple.net>
Shuhrat Dehkanov <k@efir.uz>
llyzs <llyzs.vic@gmail.com>
Johannes Weberhofer <jweberhofer@weberhofer.at>
</property>

Which might be taken from the following.
Is seems not optimal to have this string in the PO files.
There is no comment on what to do here.
#: remmina/ui/remmina_about.glade:117
msgid ""
"Adolfo Jayme Barrientos <fitojb@ubuntu.com>\n"
"Antenore Gatta <antenore@simbiosi.org>\n"
"Emmanuel Grognet <emmanuel@grognet.fr>\n"
"Giovanni Panozzo <giovanni@panozzo.it>\n"
"Jean-Louis Dupond <jean-louis@dupond.be>\n"
"Jose Gregorio Jimenez Sanchez <josegjimenez@gmail.com>\n"
"Fabio Castelli (muflone) <muflone@vbsimple.net>\n"
"Shuhrat Dehkanov <k@efir.uz>\n"
"llyzs <llyzs.vic@gmail.com>\n"
"Johannes Weberhofer <jweberhofer@weberhofer.at>\n"

In other software they only show the string/names from msgid "translator-credits" for the currently selected language.
So if i use Remmina with danish language i will only see the names of the people that contributed to the danish translated.

You are right :-\
Since we took in charge Remmina (3 years ago), we have dealt with translations almost manually.
There are some contributors that provide us the translated strings after that we generate the files to be translated as per this procedure.
We would like to put in place something cool and easy to use, or just setup gettext "the right way", but unfortunately we luck the time.
Any kind of help and/or advices are very welcome.
I'll drop the other PR and update myself the Authors.
So what are translators suppose to do with the #: remmina/ui/remmina_about.glade:117 string?

Till today nothing at all, it's a file I've updated by hand myself at each release.
I've asked you if you could update it because we were preparing the next release.
I don't know if there is an easy way to update it automatically using cmake and gettext.
As you said translators should work only on the po files.

I don't know how to write the code i just translate the po file.
I was thinking maybe the AUTHORS fil if only meant for people that write the code and not for translators.
Not that its going to hurt to have like a translator section in the AUTHORS file but maybe its just easier that a translator only have to change one po file and if people want to see who have translated they can look in the po files.

column13: snap: add password-manager-service interface for gnome-keyring
column20:
password-manager-service interface is needed to use gnome-keyring with Remmina (snap).
Interface description (from https://github.com/snapcore/snapd/wiki/Interfaces):
Can access global password manager services provided by popular Desktop Environment (eg, Secret Service and KWallets) which gives privileged access to sensitive information stored in the user's session (2.27+).
Auto-Connect: no

column20:
This is the first of several PR meant to clean an reorganize the code (aka refactoring).
In this first part, I've substituted the function name inside TRACE_CALL  to func, that is automatically translated to the function name at compile time.
I've also got rid of the ifdef/endif macro condition in the include files, used to load each include files only one time, in favor of the "pragma once" macro.
I've removed some functions that were not used in the code.
And finally I've beatified and standardized for code format.

column20: Empty passphrase should be a valid input for ssh_userauth_publickey_auto. Otherwise there is an extra passphrase dialog. It should appear only when ssh_userauth_publickey_auto really fails with empty passphrase.
column21:
Thanks.
Seems this patch is still not ideal. E.g. there are situations when first call to ssh_userauth_publickey_auto ends up with a timeout (e.g. server is temporary busy), it will raise a passphrase prompt window (which is unrelated in this given situation).
Looks like there is no nice way to determine if passphrase is set or not yet. Here are some more thoughts on this issue: https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/129724/how-to-check-if-an-ssh-private-key-has-passphrase-or-not.

column20:
This PR introduce a new module that collects anonymous usage statistics, in order to better target new Remmina features and bug fixing.
All the data collected are meant only to understand how Remmina is used by their developers.
The encryption is done end-to-end on the client side and the user can choose if he/she wants to opt-in or not.
At any moment the users have the power to request to delete all the data we have collected about them.

column21:
Please don't roll your own crypto. Why didn't you use HTTPS?
One immediately obvious weakness of this scheme is that it does not provide forward secrecy, since you always encrypt with the same long-term key.

column20:
This PR introduce a new module that collects anonymous usage statistics, in order to better target new Remmina features and bug fixing.
All the data collected are meant only to understand how Remmina is used by their developers.
The encryption is done end-to-end on the client side and the user can choose if he/she wants to opt-in or not.
At any moment the users have the power to request to delete all the data we have collected about them.
column21:
The idea was that the stats are stored encrypted also at the server side and decrypted only at our homes after downloading and deleting them. No private key is stored at the server side. Https is quite useless for this purpose.
Yes, using https in addition to this form of storage protection will also prevent, in case of private key disclosure, a man in the middle observer. But really... is it worth it? This is what we collect, no private data. Just the fact that you use or used remmina and your OS info. No username, no hostname, no private data. It's really a few more than a regular cleartext http User Agent string plus a cookie (UID).
In any case, we could think to add https support in a future release, so if someone opens an issue, I will mark it as ehnancement.
Also if you want to see what your client is sending, enable statistics (on the global preference page), open the debug window and press CTRL+T.

It would be great!
There are 2 issues for the translations

The PO files are probably not updated with the last strings

You can update it following the wiki https://github.com/FreeRDP/Remmina/wiki/Update-gettext-messages

It could be in the code there are still not translatable strings.

In this case someone should update those strings. An example of what a translatable string looks like is https://github.com/FreeRDP/Remmina/blob/next/remmina/src/remmina_connection_window.c#L533 except for debug strings, that we prefer to keep in plain (macaroni) English :-)
You can just simply search for a text that is not in the PO files in the remmina source folders and see if it can easily converted to _("...") or N_("...")

column13: Minor improvements on secure plugin and SNAP welcome message
column20:
This PR makes minor improvements on the secure plugin, allowing passwords to be saved obfuscated when the secure plugin is loaded but no secret service is running. It also avoids to unlock multiple times the keyring.
When remmina is running as a SNAP and a secret service is not reachable, a warning dialog now is shown to the user, asking him/her to connect SNAP interfaces.
column21:
This PR makes minor improvements on the secure plugin, allowing passwords to be saved obfuscated when the secure plugin is loaded but no secret service is running. It also avoids to unlock multiple times the keyring.
When remmina is running as a SNAP and a secret service is not reachable, a warning dialog now is shown to the user, asking him/her to connect SNAP interfaces.
FYI @mfvescovi
Thank you @mfvescovi

column20:
In the remmina code there is a TCP parameter that is too low, dropping connections 4 milliseconds after a keepalive if the server doesn't answer before this timeout.
This patch should fix #1487 and #975

column13: Switch back to x11 GTK backend under Wayland
column20:
It seems that GTK Clipboard handling under wayland backend is quite broken:

owner-change signal is emitted when the window take focus or is moved,
not when clipboard owner changes
The signal owner-change event data GdkEventOwnerChange has the "owner"
field set to NULL, even when the new owner is local to the application
the clipboard owner of a GtkClipboard object is only set
when we call gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner(), and is not set
when another process takes clipboard ownership.
Calling gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner() emits owner-change signal
two times.

All those problems disappear under XWayland.
Currently testing on Ubuntu 17.10 GTK 3.33.25.
Since there are no know workaround in GTK for Remmina to know:

When an external process has taken clipboard ownership
Know if the current clipboard owner is Remmia or not

we switch back to XWayland.
column21:
It seems that GTK Clipboard handling under wayland backend is quite broken:

owner-change signal is emitted when the window take focus or is moved,
not when clipboard owner changes
The signal owner-change event data GdkEventOwnerChange has the "owner"
field set to NULL, even when the new owner is local to the application
the clipboard owner of a GtkClipboard object is only set
when we call gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner(), and is not set
when another process takes clipboard ownership.
Calling gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner() emits owner-change signal
two times.

All those problems disappear under XWayland.
Currently testing on Ubuntu 17.10 GTK 3.33.25.
Since there are no know workaround in GTK for Remmina to know:

When an external process has taken clipboard ownership
Know if the current clipboard owner is Remmia or not

we switch back to XWayland.
Thank you @AsciiWolf just in time for the release of this night! Cool!

column13: travis: build flatpak using branch from PR instead of next
column20:
Currently, travis flatpak build always uses the tip of next branch. This means builds triggered by a pull request does not test the changes introduced by the PR since the code is not merged in next branch yet.
This PR aims to fix this.

column13: Fix libssh deprecations in NX plugin

column20:
This patch autodetects when libfreerdp H264 support is missing (i.e. on OpenSuse or Ubuntu). This happens because these distributions cannot distribute libavcodec/libavutils/ffmpeg on the mian package archive area. When H264 support is not available from libfreerdp and a remmina user create a new profile which defaults to an GFX AVC mode, the user gets a warning asking him/her to use a different color Depth. But some user cannot understand that message, see issue #1584.
With this patch, when libfreerdp does not expose the libfreerdp cmake WITH_GFX_H264=ON build option, Remmina will automatically remove the two color depths "GFX AVC444" and "GFX AVC420" from the color depth dropdown in the profile editor, and fallback to "GFX RFX" mode when connecting if a profile is configured for one of the two removed color depths.
This patch also remove the remmina cmake option WITH_GFX_H264 which could be used to manually disable at compile time these two color depths.
Cc @weberhofer

There were no need to add this comment, I found it quite of bad taste honestly. Did you read the GitHub terms of service or do you have an idea of how Microsoft will deliberately change those almost without notice very soon?
Anyway we still have a sync in place between the twos, so I can accept this request, but for the future we will replace the code on GitHub with just a README.md, therefore you (you as all Remmina contributors) will have two choices, open an account on GitLab, or send diff patches by email (admin at remmina dot org).
If think this is quite fair, as the email is free of any terms and conditions but the ones dictated by the GPLv2 license.
I hope you understand our point and please don't take things personally, it's out of place in our project.

column13: cmake/FindLIBSSH.cmake: Use Andreas Schneider's (upstream) variant of
column20:
FindLIBSSH.cmake.
The LIBSSH_THREADS library has been dropped in libssh >= 0.8.0.
This new version of FindLIBSSH.cmake supports that and works against
recent libssh versions.

Am Dienstag, 25. Juni 2019 schrieb Antenore Gatta:
 @sunweaver Thanks a lot for taking the time to look into this.

 BTW, we have moved to gitlab since some months in the case you have other PRs (I really hope so ;-) )

 Thanks a lot!!!
In fact, I jave started yesterday on working on the X2Go plugin for Remmina. I used the work you started some years ago. The X2Go project received some funding to make that happen.

I would actually like to ping you on this later today or this week. The plugin code I have now embeds nicely in pre 1.3.0 Remmina whereas it segfaults after the commit which made the RCW appear before plugin connection. Maybe you have an idea about this.

Mike

column20:
The "3. Submit a merge request" link in CONTRIBUTING.md yields a 404 so I do my best making this PR as reasonable as possible.
The Problem
What I try to solve is the annoying issue that switching to fullscreen ended up on the wrong monitor all the time. It didn't matter on which monitor the window was before clicking the fullscreen button.
My Solution
With a bit of googling I found out that the gdk_screen* functions where marked as deprected. So I substituded the one affecting the fullscreen functionality with the gdk_display* functions and it worked!
Cheers

column13: Fix null pointer dereference in remmina_main_quickconnect
column20:
gtk_combo_box_text_get_active_text() may returns NULL which then would
be handed as first argument to strcmp() causing a segmentation fault.
(gdb) bt
at /usr/src/debug/net-misc/remmina-1.4.1/Remmina-v1.4.1/src/remmina_main.c:1053
at
/usr/src/debug/net-misc/remmina-1.4.1/Remmina-v1.4.1/src/remmina_main.c:1077
(gdb) f 1
at /usr/src/debug/net-misc/remmina-1.4.1/Remmina-v1.4.1/src/remmina_main.c:1053
1053		if (strcmp(qcp, remmina_pref.last_quickconnect_protocol) != 0) {
(gdb) p qcp
$4 = (gchar *) 0x0
Signed-off-by: Florian Schmaus flo@geekplace.eu

column13: quick connect: remove trailing spaces when entry contains server and
column20:
port
Sometimes leading and trailing white spaces makes my quick entry fail to connect. The problem was when i added :port to the ip (ip:port), then the g_hostname_is_ip_address failed.
